website_summaries.verdict: Its few minor concerns don't interfere with the sound quality. The best choice if you want impressive sound at a low price.
pros: Reasonably priced 2-way model with rich bass
Easy to install, thanks in part to the detailed instructions
cons: Speaker cover is difficult to remove, which could be problematic if you need quick access to the interior

customer_reviews.title: Pretty damn good sound!
customer_reviews.text: My ears got tired of listening to my 9 year old daughter jam music on an Echo Dot. I picked up a small bluetooth amp from Amazon ( and 2 of these speakers. I installed 1 speaker in her bathroom, and 1 in the bedroom. The sound quality is amazing; there's enough "thump" to make you believe there's a subwoofer hidden somewhere. The aimable tweeters mean she can keep the volume low but still hear the soundtrack to whatever "tweens" listen to these days, even over the shower. I'm an Audiophile (who scoffs at in-wall or in-ceiling ANYTHING), but I'm pretty impressed.
customer_reviews.author: KillitAndGrillit

customer_reviews.title: Belated Comment
customer_reviews.text: I received the above speakers Weds. night. Thursday night I did a full visual inspection and was pleased with what I saw. I did however, thought I saw a scratch on one of the drums. I will take a closer look prior to installation. My delayed comment is due to product at this time of this comment has not been installed. I am really excited. I will be more than happy to incorporate a full and detail comment once installation and sound is protruding from said speakers are complete by the end of January, 2019.
customer_reviews.author: RE Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Best in wall speakers for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible clarity and balanced sound at a affordable price. I just put together a 5.1 setup for a small living room useing four Micca M-8S (main and surround) one Micca M-CS (center) and one Polk Audio PSW 10 (subwoofer). All together I spent around $350. The sound quality is fanamenal. I love that you can adjust the tweeter, allowing them to angle towards the listener. One could easily spend $1000 dollars on a set of speakers without yielding sound comparable to these. I could not be any happier.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Wendel

customer_reviews.title: One speaker dead on arrival - HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: One of the two speakers I received does not work at all. Probably the worst purchase I have ever made on Amazon and they are not offering any kind of support at all for the speakers. Buyer beware - DON'T BUY THESE! Update - I was able to get them returned but then was hit with a +$20 restocking fee. To restock a speaker that was not functional upon receipt. Like I said, I don't recommend that anyone buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolee

customer_reviews.title: Buyer BEWARE - This speaker has no RCA connections
customer_reviews.text: The product page states "Connectivity: RCA", however this device is actually using Banana plugs instead. You either need an amplifier which has a speaker wire output (and not an RCA output like the Pyle device has) or to buy an RCA to Speaker wire/Banana plug adapter (pretty costly!). I had to destroy my RCA/RCA cable and this was ugly + affected the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Had to make a slight modification for my install, but nice speakers
customer_reviews.text: Speakers produce a nice clean sound as the rear set of my surround system. I did have to modify one to get it installed since my studs were spaced just far enough apart for speaker without room for the install tabs. I screwed a 1x2 board to the back edge of the 2x4 on either side, cut the drywall tabs off and used 3" fine thread drywall screws to secure the speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Elong

customer_reviews.title: Horrible warranty process
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 10" and 2 8" speakers and had one of the 8" fail, after reporting the issue they are more than happy to replace under warranty but the first reply was to send them $12.00 and they would ship out a new one, then I replied and the process has now changed to... I need to send them the defective one first. All I want is to be able to ship the defective speaker back to Amazon and have a replacement shipped from Amazon. I will not ever purchase products from Micca again. I will be looking for 2 new speakers from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Meldahl

customer_reviews.title: I am no Audio File but these speakers are absolutely amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have a $7000 Martin Logan Electrostatic / SIM Audio Moon setup with Media player in my main room. I wanted streaming audio in all the other bedrooms and bathrooms. Took the plunge and decided to try these in my new 20 x 20 bedroom . I am totally blown away. I usually buy $400+ plus each speakers for this purpose. These speakers have every single range. I am driving these zones with tried and trusted (and yes cheap) Sony STR 590 Amps. The pairing is absolutely awesome People try these. It's Prime you can return them. You will not be dissapointed. FYI i am not in anyway affiliated with this site or seller..
customer_reviews.author: Mr Garry Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Affordable great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Wow..... these are amazing! They sound absolutely incredible! And for the price? These CANNOT be beat! I paired these with a Onkyo nr-tx777. 5.1.2 Atmos surround sound. I added some insulation around all the speakers and they sound even better! Deep bass and clear highs. Now, these will not rival a true subwoofer, but you don’t “have” to purchase a sub if you run the 8” speakers. That’s even made the wife happy! Affordable, solid sound, and momma even likes how they look! Also, she loves that they take up no floor space whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Where’s the space?
customer_reviews.text: I’m writing this review based on a single factor. Although installed, I don’t have my receiver yet to test sound quality. My review is based on poor component management. I bought banana plugs and went to install them but when you look at the back of these, there isn’t enough space provided to push them all the way in, making a secure connection. This is incredibly bad design to not provide enough space for components to connect properly.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: Put these in my basement ceiling - SOUND GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Put these in my basement ceiling - SOUND GREAT! The quality of the tabs is kinda weak but none broke so I'm good. If I needed to uninstall I'm probably hosed though. Anyway, I have two klipsch towers and some $500 center channel that sits on my mantel from bestbuy and these sound almost as good as the klipsch. Directional tweeter is great. Bass is solid when I put it all channel mode for music. Wish I had not wasted the $500 on the center and just gone with this brand. I bought the square ones to go into the bar but haven't hooked them up yet. I can't wait to hear um. Definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Osterberg

customer_reviews.title: In the ceiling , box them in.  It will be worth it
customer_reviews.text: Installed 4 of these speakers (8”) in my garage ceiling. Using them with a Onkyo receiver, and a JBL 12” powered subwoofer at 120hz I placed them between the joists ( truss) I cut two pieces of 2x4 , a 26” by 30” piece of 3/4” plywood. To create a ceiling box so the insulation does not sit atop the speaker. The sound imaging in my garage is amazing. I spend time rebuilding engines, building projects. Installation was a snap. Very easy. I also used the #14 speaker wire from the big box store. It has a grey plastic cover. It would be nice If they were available like the CSI speakers with backs. These speakers sound far better.
customer_reviews.author: Bill in Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend for small to medium room size 5.1 application.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Hooked up to Yahama RX-V373 5.1 receiver with these as peripherals and Micca M-CS as center and overall sound spedtrum is very impressive, at both low and high volume. They integrate very well with a 100W Yahama 10” sub, and can handle everything from the explosive to the serene. Very glad I did not spend the extra $s for similar Klipsch products. These will work for the 99% who are not concerned about needing to buy a premium brand. I do not note any high-end issues described by others. Guessing if you have a decent amp that does not over or under-drive them this can be easily controlled.
customer_reviews.author: SweenDog1

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are very inexpensive and sound it. I have no idea who is reviewing these and giving them 5-stars. Do they have functioning ears? Vocals sound super thin and there is no depth whatsoever to the sound stage. They were also very plasticky and did not look like they would last. If you need speakers to simply fill the space, go for it, but if you are into any type of fidelity, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: fitzpb

customer_reviews.title: Get them while they last at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical about these speakers but after installing them into a pair of floor standing speakers that I custom made I can say that these speaker are amazing. They pair beautifully with my surround sound and 10” subwoofers hooked up to a Dayton plate amplifier. I'm also comparing these to a pair of in wall Polk speakers I've had before and these put out crisp clean sound with more bass than expected from an in wall or in ceiling speaker. Even though I customized my installation, these are amazing for main front speakers alone. I have two custom speakers that I built and I am extremely amazed
customer_reviews.author: Customer #1

customer_reviews.title: A great option for rear in-ceiling surrounds
customer_reviews.text: Crisp and clear and rounded out my open floor plan kitchen/living room theater experience. I would prefer some towers behind the couch, but this house layout just doesn't allow it. I'm impressed at how well the surround experience still works through these in ceiling speakers. I tested them alone without the rest of the system and they should like very good midrange speakers. I did not install them into boxes so I'm sure I lost some depth, but as basic rear surrounds, they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Nic Rupert

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at the good reviews
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to test this speaker as I thought I was getting a great deal. I tested the 6.5" and 8" versions against a 6.5" Sonance I also ordered from somewhere else. The 6.5" was barely better than a cell phone speaker and the 8" was marginally better. I was a bit disappointed but wondered if it was just the test setting of on my lap. Then I tried the other speaker(that was $75) and the difference was night and day. So much so that my wife sitting next to me, without knowing any details, said she was veto'ing the Micca ones. Unfortunately, need to return the Micca ones.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these some time ago for a kitchen reno and finally just fired them up with a Sonos Amp, gotta say they sound great, ran them at low to moderately high volume on everything from acoustic guitar tracks to hard rock, Jazz & classical, for the money you be hard pressed to touch these, perfect for background music but I think with a solid multi channel amp and a good quality sub you could even put together a solid home theater with these. Seriously save the coin on the 400-500 dollar brand name in walls and try these, I suspect you’ll be writing a review similar to mine.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Best sound per dollar!
customer_reviews.text: I will start this review by saying I am rather surprised. I would never have expected a $50 speaker to have this sound quality. I installed 4 of these in the ceiling of my covered porch, I couldn’t ask for more from a speaker. They have great imaging and a very nice balance of bass and projection. Granted I am using these speakers outside, but they are perfect for the space. I am a bit of an audiophile with my interior sound systems, so I did not expect the amazing quality that these micca speakers have. I had thought about getting the 8” speakers, but went with the 6.5” to save space. More than enough bass. Beautiful sound!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Great quality speaker.
customer_reviews.text: This speaker has GREAT quality for the price. The high frequencies are crisp. It comes with a built in crossover, mounted directly to the mounting ring. It has gold plated spring loaded wire connectors for solid connections. Very pleased with the speaker. Will be buying another to replace old ceiling mounted speaker. The grille looks great also.
customer_reviews.author: RON COSNER

customer_reviews.title: but did a ton of research and found enough good feedback to take the plunge
customer_reviews.text: A little hesitant to get a "value" speaker, but did a ton of research and found enough good feedback to take the plunge. I've had some different more expensive ceiling speakers professionally installed and these actually sound better and look great!! The only challenge is going to be if they ever need to be taken down. The grills are pressure fitted onto the speaker, so it's going to be difficult to get the grill off to take them down. Hopefullly they will continue to sound great for a long time so they don't have to be replaced!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Brock

customer_reviews.title: These sound awesome!
customer_reviews.text: As part of my basement remodel, these speakers installed easily between the 12" studs and sound great. The template provided was extremely helpful. I am powering them with an Onkyo receiver and cannot stand in the same room with them on level 5 (they are Very loud). They are efficient and recreate clear highs and nice bass. I probably went overboard using these as surround and rear on a 7.1 Atmos system, but will use them with my stereo also and no way are these going back! I can't say enough about them, the detail of craftsmanship, the look and the sound are all winners! Even down to the adjustable twitter position. You will be pleased with these.
customer_reviews.author: C R Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal budget friendly speakers
customer_reviews.text: Sounds way better than a speaker at this price point has any right to. I am so glad I went with these! Installation was easy. They seem to be made of quality materials and best of all they sound awesome. At this price, you really cannot go wrong. If you are considering them, I'd recommend just get 'em! Pros: Value! Sound great Good materials Easy installation Cons: Grill attachment is a bit weak. Included sticky stuff just doesn't do the job. Just hot glue the grills in place if they don't attach snug enough.
customer_reviews.author: Smithlord

customer_reviews.title: So easy to install and paint- they’re invisible
customer_reviews.text: These were so easy to install and they sound amazing. I am very particular and run Klipsch reference speakers everywhere but didn’t want to spend a fortune for in wall surround speakers. I wasn’t expecting the sound quality from these speakers! Highly recommend for anyone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Danny Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: The 8” round ceiling speakers are impressive. For the price you can’t ask for better sound and visual aesthetic. I’m very happy with these. I used two for rear surround and two for mid surround. I’m tempted to try them for front left and right but not sure if I’m ready to attempt ceiling speakers anywhere in the front. I am impressed with the surround sound from the surround ceiling speakers. The tilting tweeters really do a good job at directing the sound where I want it. They are easy to install and to uninstall if you have to paint the ceiling or something after installed.
customer_reviews.author: Monte

customer_reviews.title: Great value, high quality!
customer_reviews.text: Installed very easy, delivers great highs and Low’s. Installed 4 in a 400 sqft room ceiling for our fitness gym. Sound is excellent, built wood enclosures for them and back filled with spray foam. Assisted with maintaining sound in the room. The space needed some additional bass that I would not expect from in-ceiling speakers so I added and external subwoofer. The sound is immersive for a workout room.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speaker for the money
customer_reviews.text: Had 4 Klipsch 6.5" ceiling speakers in master bedroom. Sounded good, wanted some more lower end. Purchased a pair of these, for some extra low end, but left the other pair of Klipsch's for the high end. These speakers are impressive. The tweeter may not be on the same level as the Klipsch's, but it's close, and a lot less expensive. Just bought another pair to replace my surround sound ceiling speakers. 'Nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing, rear speakers for my 5.1 surround sound system
customer_reviews.text: Used for rear speakers for surround sound. I was skeptical at first, but I'm really happy to report they sound awesome!! Use a compass to outline the speaker cutout, it's easier than dealing with the flimsy paper cutout template.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: These have great sound. I see myself as a bit of a stereo enthusiast, and these didn't disappoint. I have them hooked into a Yamaha RX-V679BL. with a 7.1 surround sound system and a Proficient GS10 sub-woofer. (LOTS OF GOOD BASS with this sub, it will rattle doors 30ft away from it) I have 4 of these in the ceiling and 2 more of the rectangle version mounted on the wall facing the furniture. (and another brand of center speaker) But I can (and will) crank up movies and music to a level where you couldn't talk to someone else that's in the room. they stay crystal clear, and sound fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: t morgan

customer_reviews.title: couldn't be happier with the results
customer_reviews.text: Just installed a pair in my garage to go with a HK receiver and subwoofer. couldn't be happier with the results. The quality and sound goes way further than the price. I always stuck to name brands for audio equipment but these Micca's are making me question if I was just name chasing. Sure I would love to deck out my garage with B&W's but come on lets be real I needed something that was better than my Polk's and cleaned the look up with these in wall Micca's. There is a reason these are 5 stars folks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I install audio equipment for a living and try to provide my customers with the best listening experience their budget can offer. I used theses speakers in a 5 room whole house audio application. These are the 5th or 6th different speaker I have tried on the system. Some have looked cheap, others have sounded cheap. These speakers are neither of those things. They are my new go to speaker for all of my future installs.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers!
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Great quality speakers! In my 7.2.4 Atmos setting, they serve as rear overheads (more like on top of the sitting position). The movable twitter is great which point in direction of the sitting position. Haven't played these two entirely separately in stereo mode (for probably music?) so I can't really comment on fidelity. But for my purpose it is an absolute charm and comes cheap! I am pretty handy and it took me 30 minutes to install both, including my time going back and forth into the attic.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: You can’t beat these for the price. Period.
customer_reviews.text: Way more speaker than I expected for the price. Paired these with a tiny sized Fosi amp for a way more than impressing soundstage. In a 14’x16’ room with 12’ ceilings, these things really are impressive. And that is from someone who’s done professional home audio and concert audio design and mixing. I have four more rooms to install these in and am can’t wait to hear how they too will sound
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make life easier on yourself. (Hint for mounting)
customer_reviews.text: The first speaker I did was a pain and if it was in drywall, I would have been in trouble. Luckily it was in a drop ceiling and I remembered what i did with these type speakers over a decade ago. The anchors holes are not threaded so if the start is not done perfectly, you may have issues. Solution for this, predrill the screws and then back them out and the anchors will act like you want them to when you goto mount them in drywall or drop ceiling. Installed a couple this weekend - they sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Klapperich

customer_reviews.title: Open space surround sound in-ceiling.
customer_reviews.text: I used the MICCA as a in-ceiling center Channel for my 5.1 surround system set up on a open space concept home. Oh, Boy! It turned out better than expected! You have a lot article in the internet about an all in-ceiling surround being a bad idea, but I beg the difference! It is GREAT! I used the Polk Audio V60 for my FL/FR and RL/RR and and a Klipsch 10-SW subwoofer. My receiver is an outdated YAMAHA on optical cable (which still put out a great sound), but I will replace this fall for one with a HDMI/Wi-Fi/DOLBY Atmos receiver. Good Luck!
customer_reviews.author: Fernanda

customer_reviews.title: Fallen in love
customer_reviews.text: Overall I just love these Micca speakers. For ceiling speakers you can't expect theater sound but these do about as good of a job as any ceiling speaker I've heard at a fraction of the cost. I am extremely happy with this purchase so far. The M-8C's are especially good if you need to be somewhat shallow. Otherwise go for the reference version of this speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Strait

customer_reviews.title: Sound Great In Our Home Theater
customer_reviews.text: For the price paid, the sound is very good to excellent in a basement room that we've converted into a home theater We're running an 70 watt Yamaha 5.1 home theater receiver - in retrospect, probably should have bought something a bit more powerful. If your budget is limited, don't hesitate to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Afghan Steve

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great as a center channel speaker
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a center channel speaker but did not have the clearance behind so I had to build a small enclosure so it would fit where I needed it to go. It sounds great for voices and center channel sounds. (Some other reviews seemed to confuse this with the Micca L/R stereo speakers. This is designed to be a center channel speaker.) The speaker is above the Flat-screen TV in the image. It is considerably more efficient than my other speakers so I had to adjust the surround settings in my stereo. Overall a great buy, though!
customer_reviews.author: Hodgepodgerama

customer_reviews.title: Nice speaker .
customer_reviews.text: I bought this speaker to add a speaker to our church nursery . It came well packed , looks nice , and was an easy install . I liked that it came with a good "cut-out" pattern and I love the spring loaded cable attach points . The most important thing with a speaker is sound quality and with this one it sounds as tho the speaker in in the room with you . Of course I added a volume control in case the little ones need a nap .
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are fantastic! In my previous house, I used speakers that were 4 times the price, but these speakers sound every bit as good. Silk tweeters, poly woofers, nice size magnets, and quality crossover make these speakers an outstanding value! I matched 4 of these ceiling speakers with a center channel, and 2 of the in-wall speakers for left and right channels and I couldn’t be happier with the sound!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn L.

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker. Mounted in ceiling for Dolby Atmos set ...
customer_reviews.text: Great speaker. Mounted in ceiling for Dolby Atmos set up. Sound real good, larger speaker allows lower crossover setting, I also turned up the level to better hear sound effects. Il love the way Dolby Atmos adds to sound field . My set up is Def Tech, Fluance, Martin Logan and Micca. I know it's a mix up and a no no by expert standards but I am happy with the sound . Happy with sound from Micca speakers, would have liked to have tried an all Micca set up but already had other speakers. Will buy other Micca speakers in the future, great sound for lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers, but no longer available it seems
customer_reviews.text: The sound surprisingly good for as small as they are. I docked one star because one of the speakers arrived with the loose tweeter. Thankfully it snapped back in and was not actually broken. It was so firm in there I have no idea how it came loose, or whether it was packed that way. I was going to order 4 but there were only 3 available and no apparent further availability. Even a search outside of amazon turned up very few.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P Godelfer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely best theater speakers for the money
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are very well made and easy to install. Comes with a template for cutting the hole that is also a paint mask. I bought this center a 4 smaller 2 ways for the rest of the system. All were perfect out of the box. I could have spent so much more but wouldn't have improved my experience. I would recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R

customer_reviews.title: Great ceiling speakers for rear home theater channels
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and installed these in the ceiling for the rear channels of my home theater while the house was under construction. I've been in the house now for six months and these speakers sound great and provide good rear fill. For those wondering what to do when you have sprayed in attic insulation, I bought some batt insulation and sort of hollowed out an area to provide the speaker enough air volume, then they sprayed the insulation over that. Now, if I need to take the speakers down for whatever reason, a ton of insulation won't come down with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and easy installation for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, Amazing sound (highs and lows) and easy installation for the price, I would suggest you definitely need to use a subwoofer with these as they don't put out much bass by themselves, BUT I was told if you put some insulation behind them in the hollow wall, it may help. I will update this review when I get some insulation. I also purchased the Center channel Micca M-CS and the M-8C 8-In-Ceiling. I am happy with this purchase. The construction seems very durable and well made and the magnets are a decent size as well.
customer_reviews.author: cssmgt

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I have these in my kitchen and bathroom. They sounds pretty good. I have one set on 100x100W amp and the other on a 50x50W amp and the 100W is turned almost all the way down. Frequency response is decent. Obviously not going to bump, but doesn't sound tinny. These fill the rooms with sound no problem and music and speech both sound good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Penny

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat it for the $$$$
customer_reviews.text: Had serious doubts with this setup. Bought the center and 4 corners for a 5.1 in wall setup. The 8" 2 ways, and the center 5.25" 3 way's make pretty good sound. Lacks a little of the full mid range, but the voice coil on the center is pretty darn good. I would think you would have to spend well over $500/speaker to notice better quality, but for a simple theater setup, i would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Sounds amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this product for my surround channels. For most DIYers this will be relatively easy to install but if you have no experience cutting drywall and drilling holes in the floor I would steer clear. Took about 3 hours to install with running 75’ of speaker wire through the basement. Directions are a little vague but most handy folks should be able to figure them out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Nice speakers. Cheaper than the polks I paired them with.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to add a second set of polk speakers out on my lanai. Then I saw these. They are great speakers for much less cost. I just started listening to them and they sound great. Wish I noticed them before I bought the Polk speakers. Took a while to get here even with prime. Too many delays. Amazon is dropping the ball
customer_reviews.author: crash

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Easy install.
customer_reviews.text: Put mine in ceiling as rear surrounds. Template was spot on. I knew where my joists were located so I just had to maneuver around the furring strips. You need to hand tighten the locking bolts. You’ll feel the pressure and resistance build so you don’t strip the plastic. Sound is light on bass but very accurate. Good value for the sound you’re paying for.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Good "elevator music" sound for whole-house system. I now have 12 of them replacing the tinny cheap builder speakers installed when the house was built. Easy to install but not so easy to remove for painting, etc. One or more of the clamps will fall down inside the wall no matter how careful you are.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Attractive speakers but handle with care
customer_reviews.text: Like: mostly solid, attractive looking, sounds good Dislike: the posts are too close together for anything but smallish banana plugs (I couldn’t use the ones I had because they touched each other); also I broke off the posts of the one of them because they kind of overhang near the edge of the speaker and I didn’t quite make the mounting hole big enough (my fault for sure) and half the circuit board broke with the posts
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: All this for the price?  Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say anything more than awesome for the price.... I can't believe these are priced at where they are priced... I use them outdoors in poolhouse. Combine these with a subwoofer and these are awesome... Bought the Polk Audit sub for $99 here on Amazon and it sounds awesome as well and together they are great!! So for less than $200 - have these great in-wall speakers combined with a powered subwoofer that sounds great... These are great for outdoor, patio and other non-primary listening area applications.... The speakers are a touch "bright", but for the price - I am definitely not complaining...
customer_reviews.author: T. Thorson

customer_reviews.title: Buy for atmos!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using these as atmos speakers. They have very nice bass and sound quality. I’ve only heard klipsch ceiling speakers and the miccas are comparable or better. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre El Capitan de Castanets Enimigo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for ATMOS
customer_reviews.text: I put these in with a system mainly of Klipsch speakers and though the voicing is definitely different, they are efficient enough where after room correction it sounds great even cranked up to theater level. They are missing the high end features like a magnetic grill, but have tilt tweeters and once installed sound great, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CigarObsession

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid speaker with quick & easy install
customer_reviews.text: I've been really happy with these. The sound is superb - not professional-grade but perfect for 99% of the population. The installation was simple and quick. I have them connected to the INSMA T25W+25W Wireless Bluetooth 4.0 Hifi Audio Receiver Digital Amplifier Board connected to an Alexa-enabled BLU R1 HD and a RaspPi in Kiosk mode. Very slick. The screens are nice clean white, the bass is solid, and the pivoting tweeter allows for better sound travel than just straight up & down.
customer_reviews.author: SuperBrian

customer_reviews.title: Silver Ticket 82W Is much better for less money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Micca M8-S based on the excellent reviews. However, I am NOT impressed. These speakers have decent bass & midrange but the high frequencies are terrible. The tweeter is too bright and very shrill. I bought the Silver Ticket 82W series in wall speakers at the same time. MUCH better bass & midrange. The highs are a touch lacking but much better than the shrillness of the Micca M8-S. I know both speakers are entry level and I didn’t expect much when I purchased them. The Silver Ticket 82W’s actually surprised me with their sound quality considering how cheap they were. However, don’t expect them to sound like $150+ in wall speakers. The Micca’s have been returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are great speakers and can handle everything my Pioneer Elite receiver ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had these speakers about two weeks now and I can't say enough about them. They are great speakers and can handle everything my Pioneer Elite receiver throws at it. I do have a SVS PB2000 Subwoofer which handles a load of bass, but don't let the Micca's fool you those 8 inch subwoofers can handle all of the mid-bass. They arrived quickly and the speakers were packaged securely, you can spend a load more but I have 3 in-walls and 6 in-ceilings and couldn't be happier. Great job Micca
customer_reviews.author: Elias D. Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Impressive even at double the price.
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with these. I have a 5.2.1 atmos system and I’m using these as the surrounds. I was a little skeptical but after the install I’m over impressed. I probably wouldn’t use these as mains or a center but as surrounds they do a fantastic job. They don’t sound off with my Klipsch/Yamaha set up and being in wall allowed me to place them better than I could bookshelves. Easy install, would gladly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TJMack20

customer_reviews.title: Micca M-8C 8 Inch 2-Way In-Ceiling In-Wall Speaker
customer_reviews.text: The sound great and are nice looking. We left the grilles off because of their attractive copper color. They were a little more difficult to anchor in the ceiling than they should have been as they didn't seem to want to tighten down. I had to keep turning and turning the screws hoping they would tighten before they became stripped. The only other downside is the way the grilles attach. If you should ever need to remove them, they could easily be bent and warped out of shape thus making their reinstallation very difficult and maybe impossible. However, I do recommend them and would purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN S

customer_reviews.title: Micca M-85 Speakers
customer_reviews.text: It took a couple of days to install the speakers. I needed to make frames to cover the holes from the old speakers. After setting up the speakers, they sound great. I highly recommend these speakers. I play minidisk's, cd's, records, and usb's through them, they sound great with theses speakers.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers! I was going to buy the Polk ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Speakers! I was going to buy the Polk RC60i's for the surround speakers in my basements 7.1 setup. I opted to try these instead, after reading all the great reviews. They were also cheaper. I literally couldn't be happier. These speakers rock! They sound great, they are such a step up from what I had. My system is finally the way I want it. The speakers were a piece of cake to install. I mounted them to the ceiling tiles in my basement. They almost blend right in. You can hardly even see them. I recommend these speakers to anyone. I can't believe they are selling for this price. Snatch them up while you can.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reimann

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: You cant beat these for the price. I was about to buyba set of polks for twice the price but after reading the reviews i decided to try them. They are rear surrounds for my hone theater room but these guys could be used for mains if needed. I decided to listen to music usibg then and was shocked at how good they sounded. May buy 2 more to replace my definitive bipolar sides.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A in Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but installtion deapth needed is more than what listed in the product details! Make sure you have enough room before
customer_reviews.text: great speaker works as detailed - producing a good sound quality - I installed it in my basement wall and installation was easy BUT measurements in the description are incorrect! It's deeper than what is in the product description - I had to cut more into the wall to install it properly! Make sure you have enough depth !
customer_reviews.author: esalomo

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers
customer_reviews.text: The speakers arrived on time and in good condition. They appear to be of good quality and look very professional. I put them in my basement drop ceiling so I could add Dolby Atmos to my movie system, and they sound really great. They are designed to be put in drywall, but I purchased the Monoprice 106033 Installation Kit for a Pair of 8-Inch In-Ceiling Speakers which worked perfectly in the drop ceiling. The first time you listen to the opening sequence of Blade Runner 2049 with Atmos you will be glad you bought these speakers. Very good sound for the price.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Like I said
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these have worked quite well for us. Bought two different 8 inch ceiling speaker pairs to try and compare. Really didn't feel there was much difference. These were a couple bucks more, and I thought about returning them to save a few bucks and buy a second set of the other brand. But in the end, I skipped the hastle, ate the few dollars and kept. Like I said, they sound good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lonni W

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and easy install
customer_reviews.text: My husband just installed these in our basement that we are finishing. He loves them!! He’s very picky with his sound systems so I was a little surprised when I got these without being able to listen to them. So far they have been great, they look great and we’re easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: You don't need to mount these inside of wall
customer_reviews.text: You don't need to cut your drywall to put these speakers in, I bought them because their way center than regular box speakers. Then I use some 3+1/2 inch pine and plywood to make the enclosure. as a result you can have speakers that you can hang off a wall with ease. Entire 7.1 system is under $200 just crazy
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound far above and beyond their price point.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound amazing and at a fraction of the cost of more well known brands. While I am no audiophile, I do believe these have a very rich sound and was amazed at the amount of base they generated even in absence of my subwoofer. They appear to be very well constructed and the mounting tabs that spring out to secure them to your wall work quite well. I would highly recommend these to any budget conscience buyer who wants very good sounding speakers and a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Good bass. Good price. Easy Install.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these speakers after seeing them listed in the top 5 recommended on a few reliable Audi review sites. They did not disappoint. The price is very reasonable. And they have good bass, which was very important since I was buying them for sorround sound, and I watch a lot of action movies. And, I bought them to connect to my Sonos Connect Amp, and the music sounds great. After installing the first of 4, the remaining 3 were very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: chanda3x

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I installed these last year for my brother's home theater system and they are awesome. Bought some foe me and connected them to a Bose SA5 amp. They sound great! Will do the rest of the house. Bass sounds good. Crisp sound. No regrets. Why spend $$$$ on Bose ceiling speakers? And i love Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick C.

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding speakers.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. Way better than the small Klipsch satellite speakers I had. (Although those were great). In a pretty good size great room. I use them on SMALL and they sound great. But I do have a 12" Klipsch subwoofer and Klipsch center speaker. I love the directional tweeter. Even the wife thinks they sound amazing and movie watching sound has been great. Nice and loud and clear. I used them as LARGE for a bit, still sounded great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: 6 pairs used to replace whole-house music system ceiling speakers. Size fit was #1 criterion but sound quality was better than expected. One set was re-tasked as rear pair for surround TV sound & holds up well to more expensive front speakers that are part of our music system. Attachment mechanism doesn't work well if cutout is adjacent to a ceiling joist but biggest negative is that the painted grills don't stand up to humidity. Grills in the sets installed in our outdoor lanai ceiling began rusting 2 years after installation. I would buy them again, but repaint the grills with better waterproofing before installing them.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L.

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a winner!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality speaker. Be careful when painting the grills. If you get the paint too thick, you might get stuck. The built in masking kit (cardboard cut out, is very helpful. The sound quality is reasonable, and only a serious audiophile would have an issue. I've installed a number of in wall speakers and appreciate the value and quality in these speakers. Knowing how hard it is to get good low end sound from an in wall speaker, I went with the 8" model, and am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound! Easy Install!
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound from these speakers. Pictured here is the 3rd pair I’ve purchased so far. This set is installed in my master bedroom. Of the six speakers, I had one screw tab break off. It helps if you screw them in a little before installing in the ceiling. Another tip is to make sure you have ample room around your speakers. I had a few that were a little tight.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: Went through AVS forums first and everyone kept raving about these because of how low price is and how well they sound. Pulled the trigger and got 5 of these, lame you can only buy 4, needed 5 for surround sound. Last one had to get from another 3rd party that's annoying and almost drop a star for that but they sound really good and have really good bass. This is not for my main movie watching room but great for music during entertaining. A+ On sound
customer_reviews.author: James Doerner

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I bought four 6.5" ceiling speakers and four 6.5" wall speakers for Atmos and surround speakers. They compliment 2 Klipsch towers and center channel very well. At 87db, they aren't extremely efficient, however since they're not the main audio source they're more than enough. Easy to install. Easily painted. Simply can't beat the value.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Smih

customer_reviews.title: Great for 5.1 or 7.1 surround
customer_reviews.text: Bought six of these as surround speakers along with their big brothers left right and center channel Micca speakers. Two of the six Micca M-8C's had their tweeter hanging loose, I was able to match up the tabs and press them back into their pivot no problem. They are remarkably clean and loud, the sound is very high quality and my son says they are "awesome". Installation was easy, the hardest part was running the wires in the walls/ceilings. This would be great for new construction or a pre-wired home.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: “Good” not “Great” sound on the cheap....
customer_reviews.text: I guess I was expecting more from all the positive reviews... I would consider these car audio quality speakers... not as crisp and clear as I was hoping... but they are like $35 ... for $35 the value is good. You get what you pay for I suppose...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Elliott Mauro

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, priced right.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a breeze, sounds quality is excellent, and after painting them to match the wall, the look is seamless. I will say that you need a subwoofer to complete the system for a home theater. If you’re going to use these as light radio speakers for a patio, bar, etc they sound crisp and clear - they have some bass, but not enough to drown you out. I would highly recommend these to anyone for any setup you’re planning to do.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Fassett

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price for good quality sound. As expected the low frequencies would need a subwoofer, but for daily listening in dining/kitchen area, it works very well, and quite satisfied with these speakers. The directional tweeter is very helpful in directing the sound. Quality of build is excellent and easy to install in the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Sandeep Saksena

customer_reviews.title: I was able to easily install these speakers in our ceiling
customer_reviews.text: Wife of user here: I was able to easily install these speakers in our ceiling. I love that the box includes a cutout template. All I had to do was use a studfinder, make sure the template wasn't over a stud, trace a circle, and cut! I used a handheld drywall saw with ease. I loved that the terminals are a push-button- so much easier than the tabs or screws. The speakers sound great, and look great in our ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: The October Man

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used these in a 6 in ceiling speaker setup. The sound pretty nice overall. The speaker itself looks to be nice quality with nice materials. They install ok but the plastic clips that hold the speaker into the ceiling are on the cheaper side so be careful when installing them. They seem to want to crack easy. Overall great value for the price
customer_reviews.author: Robotica Industries

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Wow...these sound great...installed in my garage and aim tweeters toward my work bench. Great value...cutout template is spot on. Used another guy's suggestion and bought the flower pots from Home Depot then lined them with insulation...drilled a small hole to run the speaker wire. I used metal strapping for ac duct work to strap them down. I also sealed the edge of the flower pot rubber gasket material. Only thing I can complain about is getting the grill off. You need a really sharp pick because the holes in the grills are tiny. Overall they are easy to install and sound great.
customer_reviews.author: jomede

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced some existing speakers. The existing holes were flush with the beam studs. I followed another users recommendation of mounting a 1x2 board on the stud, removing the mounting brackets on the stud side and using 3 inch power screws to secure the speaker. This required purchasing the boards and screws and additional measuring and steps. However, it worked beautifully and considering the sound for the price, these speakers can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Kevster

customer_reviews.title: terrific sound, obvious care taken to produce quality sound ...
customer_reviews.text: I have written maybe 3 reviews in 10 years, but I had to write one for these. You know those JBL and other speakers you spent a bunch of money. Try these next time! I just removed a pair of JBL's (bought less than a year ago from Amazon) in a bathroom and replaced with the 6.5" version of these. The JBL's were a bit muddy. These: high quality, terrific sound, obvious care taken to produce quality sound without a fancy name. Won't go back to any of those "brand name" speakers again. You won't be disappointed. In fact, how many other products do you see with consistent 5-star ratings? Practically none. These deserve it!
customer_reviews.author: Markiee77

customer_reviews.title: Great value and sound and well made
customer_reviews.text: I have used these speakers in many whole house audio systems. They will not disappoint these things are awesome, very good sound across all frequencies. You will not find a better speaker at this price point. I am a sound engineer and I know sound and these things are great !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rud1941

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is a great buy, for anyone not looking to drop money ...
customer_reviews.text: I had previously bought pyle ceiling speakers and needed another wall speaker for the center channel. The micca blows away the pyle. I'm probably going to replace them with micca and put them in the bedroom. My only gripe is the mesh cover. It's just a pain to deal with and doesn't hide the woofers very well. For the price this is a great buy, for anyone not looking to drop money for high end equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Great value, easy install!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using these for whole home music, so I have one of these in 5 different spots in my house. Bass isn’t as good as I expected, but it could be the size of my room. I have 9ft ceilings and a 20 by 30 main room. I probably should have 2 installed in a room this size. Overall, it’s a great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: matula

customer_reviews.title: Great for all but the most discerning audiophile.
customer_reviews.text: These sound good. Probably not audiophile good, but I don't have audiophile ears. The 8" model has lots of punchy bass. And since I have many of them mounted in the ceiling the punchiness is magnified. The directional tweeters are a nice touch. The build quality looks very high. Get a pair of them and try them out. At these prices why not?
customer_reviews.author: Mr_Fastbucks

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and sounds great
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and sounds great. Being an audiophile I wanted something that sounded great in a very large room. (4) 8" and (1) center speaker in the ceiling paired with my existing subwoofer really bring the sound to life. I very much recommend these speakers to anyone on the fence or skeptical about the price.
customer_reviews.author: DC_Chris

customer_reviews.title: Micca M-CS Center Channel Speaker does not deliver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Mica M-CS speaker as a center channel companion to two Micca M8S in-wall speakers. I was attracted to these speakers due to the positive reviews and very low price point. The M8S speakers perform well, but the sound from M-CS center channel speaker is flat, not crisp, and deflates the system. There are other reviews that indicate this, but I thought I would note this as well. I will be disposing of this speaker and adding a higher end center channel to my system.
customer_reviews.author: Hanson

customer_reviews.title: bought 2
customer_reviews.text: Would totally buy these again. Sound quality is very clean with good harmonic range. Using them as outdoor patio speakers and was more than impressed with the sound quality and easy to install. Template is very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Very clean and professional look with easy install and great sound.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 4 of these over the past 6 months. They're an install easy, sound great and give off lots of volume. These are bigger than I though they would be as the size only measures the actual speaker and not the surrounding encasing but they look and work great. They look very clean and professional since they are mounted inside the wall. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is only one speaker.. Be aware
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I didn't read the fine print, but who the hell buys ONE speaker. I assumed it was a pair...
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding speakers. They look nice in the walls of the ceiling. We purchase six of these, two for the rear surround, and 4 for the atmos height speakers in the ceiling. Repair them with pioneer front speakers for a great theater system.
customer_reviews.author: Q-360

customer_reviews.title: Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Micca M-8C 8 Inch 2-Way in-Ceiling speakers as "test" speakers before I spent a lot of money on the "real" speakers because I wasn't sure I'd like speakers mounted in the ceiling. I'm blown away by these. They sound great. My only comment is that the bass is a little less punchy than I'd like. I think they use a smaller magnet. Other than that these are by far the best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Paramus Guy

customer_reviews.title: Gotta getcha one and see for yerself.
customer_reviews.text: A little late on my critique here, folks, but not to worry- just needed to break this baby in before I posted an honest review. This little speaker puts higher-priced versions to shame with its clean, pure sound. Easy installation; just make sure you leave enough room between studs to use the handy (and sturdy) fold-down clips to secure it to the drywall on both sides of the speaker. I didn't, but then my name ain't Einstein either so get off my case already. Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Richardsson55

customer_reviews.title: Made it 6 months, time to replace.
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months, the audio has started to crackle and cut out periodically for several seconds at a time. Ive tried it on several different outputs, tv, dvd, xbox and sound cuts out each time. If i remove this speaker from my reciever and run audio through my front speakers, the audio never cuts out. You get what you pay for. Shoukd have known better.
customer_reviews.author: zack

customer_reviews.title: Sound is better than expected!!!
customer_reviews.text: Installation was fairly easy and the sound is far better than expected for $40 per speaker. The quality of the speakers seem to be good as they appear to be built well. Time will tell, but for now I am completely satisfied and would recommend this to anyone who is watching their budget but wants to add surround sound to their TV.
customer_reviews.author: lafonte98

product_meta.title: Micca M-8S 8 Inch 2-Way in-Wall Speaker with Pivoting 1" Silk Dome Tweeter (Each, White)
product_meta.description: Style:8-Inch In-WallNOTE: this listing is for one speaker, buy as many as needed! the Micca M-Series of in-wall and in-ceiling speakers have been designed for Optimal performance in a wide variety of home entertainment applications, from providing relaxed background music, to a high impact 7-channel home theater system. Built with high quality components and rigorously tested design, M-Series speakers deliver exceptional value and are well reviewed by owners and critics. Dynamic and balanced the M-8S is a 2-way in-wall speaker with a high excursion 8" poly woofer and a 1" soft dome tweeter. This combination provides great flexibility in terms of application and suitability to different music tastes. In addition to smooth and natural vocals, the 8" woofer is capable of robust bass output. This allow the M-8S to be used without the need for a subwoofer in many installations, or seamless integration if a subwoofer is used. Imaging and clarity the 1" soft dome tweeter provides abundant detail and clarity, generating solid and focused imaging for all sound sources in a spacious sound stage. Designed for a broadened listening sweet spot, the tweeter employs a diffuser to assist off-axis response as well as a pivoting mechanism to achieve proper aiming. Perfect integration between the tweeter and woofer is achieved through a 12dB crossover network. Once installed and setup, the M-8S projects a realistic sound stage with excellent resolution. Specifications - woofer: 8" Mica-Polypropylene cone, butyl rubber surround - tweeter: 1" pivoting silk dome, Ferro fluid cooled - crossover: 12dB/Octave - frequency response: 40hz-20khz - impedance: 8 ohms - Sensitivity: 90dB 1W/1M - power handling: 100 watts (each) - outer dimension: 10" (w) x 14.13" (H) - cutout dimension: 8.75" (w) x 12.75" (H) - mounting depth: 3.6"
feature_bullets: 2-way in-wall speaker with a high excursion 8" poly woofer and a 1" soft dome tweeter
Perfect integration between the tweeter and woofer is achieved through a 12dB crossover network
Smooth and natural sound signature with robust bass output for impactful listening experience
Designed for optimal performance in a wide variety of home entertainment applications
Easy to install and can be painted to blend into any décor

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,636 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
